alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80 (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 31 at 2:18PM MDT until April 04 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 2 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 20 to 30 inches possible, locally up to 4 feet in the Upper Cottonwoods and Davis County area mountains. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 9 PM MDT this evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday afternoon through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions are expected on all mountain routes. Travel may be quite difficult at times. Traction restrictions are also possible. Those with travel plans through Parleys, the Cottonwoods and other mountain routes through the Wasatch should be prepared for severe winter driving conditions Sunday night through Tuesday and check for potential closures due to avalanche mitigation.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx.
